radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate concentric left ventricular thickening (1.5 cm), ejection fraction was 50%. Right ventricle mildly enlarged and hypokinetic, with a thickened free wall. Severe biatrial enlargement. St. Jude mitral-valve prosthesis well seated with a mean gradient of 5 mm Hg, minimal mitral regurgitation, mild aortic insufficiency, and moderate tricuspid regurgitation. Dilated and nonpulsatile inferior vena cava. Mild-to-moderate pulmonary hypertension.

Chronically occluded, well-collateralized posterior descending artery and diffuse, nonobstructive coronary artery disease. Elevated biventricular filling pressures, rapid y descent in the right atrial pressure tracing, near equalization of diastolic pressures.
